fields.description: User Property field is missing and clients are requesting it.
fields.summary: Add user property field back

fields.description: Just as the summary describes. Would like to see an option to configure session timeout length when a user chooses the remember me option
fields.summary: Configurable remember me session timeout

fields.description: Currently users in the Application Access menu are sorted by *Username*, it would be easier for users to manage Application Access if you could sort it by Name as well.
fields.summary: Add the ability to sort users by Name in the Application Access menu.

fields.description: Password policy rules were removed with the new changes, and no longer enforced. Bringing back password policy or incorporating that into the new user management section will be very beneficial.
fields.summary: Enforce Password Policy

fields.description:
It is possible for customers using Google Apps integration to remove JIRA OnDemand from their Google domain using the Google Apps control panel. This breaks integration with OnDemand, but doesn't really provide them with any feedback. It does not trigger a request to convert to a non-Gapps-enabled OnDemand instance, or cancel their subscription to OnDemand. This can catch them by surprise.

It would be good if we could detect when they have removed the Gapps integration and provide guidance about what their options are.
fields.summary: Provide guidance to users that remove JIRA OnDemand from their Google domain

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
"Enable Nested Group" is turned off in Atlassian Cloud platform. Atlassian Cloud customers would like to get this feature enabled as since Jira 4.3 release, the new user management has the ability to use nested groups.

It seems that the reason behind disabling this is that: there is a potential risk that Atlassian Cloud licence will not work properly with nested groups.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement nested group feature as implemented in Jira Server.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Support Nested Groups in Atlassian Cloud platform

fields.description: User Management - Add column or color to showcase Inactive users
fields.summary: User Management - Add column or color to showcase Inactive users

fields.description: In Atlassian OnDemand, when using the 'Create users' option to add a new user you can not paste in an email in "James Dellow <james.dellow@rippleffectgroup.com>" format. The Email address(es) field breaks the email address into three parts: James, Dellow, and <james.dellow@rippleffectgroup.com> (which is not a valid email address either). The dialog should recognise addresses that are pasted in this format. Ideally, the screen name part should be used instead of the email address for the screen name created by OnDemand.
fields.summary: Support the ability to add users in the format of "screen name <email@address.com>"

fields.description:
An improvement to User Management would be an API allowing teams to build audit reports to suit their needs.

Providing a supported API provides customisation options for teams to meet their reporting needs.

An example report would list the users within an OnDemand instance and their current application access.
fields.summary: JIRA User Management REST API
As an Administrator I would like to customise the log in screen

fields.description:
h4. Problem: 
If invite is mistakenly sent out there is nothing immediate the _Administrator_ can do but wait for the expiry.

h4. Suggestion: 
There needs to be an improvement to revoke or rest the invite sent.
fields.summary: Reset or revoke an invitation

fields.description: Providing admins the ability to sort their users by last active date will help determine users that are used often vs no longer in use so they can save on licenses.
fields.summary: Ability to sort users by last active

fields.description:
Users only receive a confirmation when using the 'self signup' functionality provided by UM:

{quote}An email has been sent to <email>.

Please click on the link inside the email to continue.

If you do not receive the email within the next 10 minutes, please check your spam or junk email folder just in case the email got delivered there instead of your inbox.{quote}

If a users email already exists in the system there is no dialog.

An improvement could be to advise the user a profile is already assigned to the account.
fields.summary: No user feedback when using functionality from 'sign up options' with UM

fields.description: It would be nice to have GApps integration for OnDemand that doesn't require JIRA for it to work.
fields.summary: Google Apps Integration for OnDemand Instances without JIRA

fields.description:
Looking at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CROWD/Specifying+a+User's+Aliases - it's currently supported in Crowd, but not OnDemand.

The issue is that since there is no company attribute (Confluence does but not others, e.g. JIRA), we have to set the username to user [company name] - however, the problem is, e.g. with Google Apps integration, we'll need to set this in Google Apps and effects emails and other Google Apps that we use (not just Atlassian products).

We need:

1. A consistent user profile across OnDemand and a way to show "company" as part of the user's Display name property without hacking the username attribute.
2. User alias to be configurable for OnDemand.

Thanks!
fields.summary: User Alias Support

fields.description: After the implementation of the new user managment section, the [Importing Users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Importing+Users] page should be updated accordingly.
fields.summary: Update documentation regarding importing users

fields.description:
When a customer has activated the option for public account creation, there is nothing indicating this to people who visit the front page of an instance, unless the follow the "log in" link in the top right, which prompts them with a log in screen and below that a link to create an account.
Though it's just a minor inconvenience, could this be displayed on the front page instead?
fields.summary: Provide a "create account" link on frontpage of AOD instances

fields.description: On the log in page, add a button so un-registered user can request a log in. Upon pressing the register button a dedicated administrator should receive an e-mail to validate if this person should be granted access/
fields.summary: On the login page, add a button so external users can request a registration/account

fields.description: Once Google Apps integration is turned on in a customer instance, they no longer have the option to 'Invite Users' only the option to add users individually.
fields.summary: The "Invite Users" button is not available after Google Apps integration is turned on

fields.description:
We have users that do not have access to email and do not gain value from the notifications.  However, an email address is required. The issue is that putting in an invalid email to meet the requirement is that those bouncebacks then get logged as comments (since we use the function to reply via email) on issues and then those emails go out because a comment was made - a vicious circle. 

It would be value-add to not require an email. I'm not certain the specific reason for requiring it as it seems logical that they won't receive emails via the notification system.  But, that is the decision of the admin setting up the user. 

Thus, the improvement request is to not require an email address for a user.  You could set it as an admin option to require it; but allow the admin to make that decision.
fields.summary: Provide ability to not require an email address for a user

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolution update}
Hi,

We recently released an improved version of the G Suite integration, as part of Atlassian Access, that supports syncing G Suite groups. Learn all about the changes in this blog post.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/blog/2020/10/were-changing-g-suite-settings-and-giving-you-a-free-upgrade-for-6-months]

Thank you,

Narmada Jayasankar

Lead Product Manager, Atlassian Access
{panel}
 

 

 

A customer has expressed interest in support for groups from G Suite.

This would sync group names and memberships from G Suite groups to Atlassian Cloud site user bases.

There is an API for this:

[http://code.google.com/googleapps/domain/gdata_provisioning_api_v2.0_developers_protocol.html#Retrieve_Group_Example]
fields.summary: Integrate with G Suite groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Users should be redirected to the *'Can't access your account?'* page instead of the *'Forgot username or password'* page when trying to reset their passwords by clicking on the *'Unable to access your account?'* link on the login page.

That's because when the username of a user matches his email address, the process of resetting the password gets confused and painful.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a user with a username that matches the email address
# Log off the instance
# Click on the 'Unable to access your account?' link on the login page
# Fulfill the box with your username (which is your email address as well)
# You'll receive an email containing your username (as if you were trying to figure it out instead of resetting the password) and a link stating that you can also reset your password if you wish - click on that link
# You'll get redirected to the 'Can't access your account?' page
# Choose the option to reset the password and fulfill the box with your username again
# You'll receive an email containing a link that will redirect you to the reset password page - click on that link to redefine your password

*Now*, the same steps if your email address *doesn't* match your username

# Create a user with a username that matches the email address
# Log off the instance
# Click on the 'Unable to access your account?' link on the login page
# Fulfill the box with your username
# You'll receive an email containing a link that will redirect you to the reset password page - click on that link to redefine your password

*Forgot username or password (page)*

!forgot_username_password.png!

*Can't access your account? (page)*

!can't_access_your_account.png!
fields.summary: Users should be redirected to the 'Can't access your account?' page

fields.description:
The title and content of the message doesn't make clear why it happened. The content only says that it was not possible to grant application access to a certain user to a certain product.

It would be great to have something telling the user that he/she is running out of licenses on a certain product *and* that's why it was not possible to grant application access to the user. Thus, he/she will have to increase their user limit license for that product or perhaps retrieve application access from another user and grant it to the new one. Also the message subject isn't very intuitive. "Username Conflict" is not the same as "You ran out of licenses".
fields.summary: "Username Conflict Notification" message quite confusing

fields.description:
At the moment it isn't possible to rename a group once it is created. Since we use the groups sometimes to reflect out team structures and these are renamed from time to time, this causes a lot of effort because i always have to create a new group, reassign the members and then check all studio-components and replace the old group permissions with the new one.

Especially if a group is used in many different projects, this is hard to maintain!

I know that there is a proposal NOT to reflect the organisational structure within these groups. But creating per-project groups isn't even better, because then if people change the team, i have to modify all project roles instead of just reassigning him to his new organisational group.

So from my perspective the possibility to change the name of a group would save me a lot of time and be a great improvement for the studio, so when will you implement it? ;-)
fields.summary: Renaming of groups should be possible

fields.description:
Some admins would still like to remove the user completely from the system.

One suggestion: have the option during the delete action, to be able to bulk transfer these associations to another user...?
fields.summary: Improve the experience when deleting a user that has product associations

fields.description:
Being able to link a OnDemand account to Google is really useful from an SSO perspective but the full benefits come when you can flow through deactivation of the account. The ability of users with Google linked account to still create an OnDemand password, while necessary for some features (as discussed at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+users+and+groups+with+Google+Apps#ManagingusersandgroupswithGoogleApps-PasswordsandGoogleApps), isn't likely to be required by all users.

2 Feature requests:
- there should be a mechanism to indicate that certain user accounts can/can't (I would have a preference for "can" but understand that would potentially break existing configs) use an OnDemand passwords.
- there should be a mechanism such that when the Google credentials are deactivated, any OnDemand password can no longer be used.
- there should be a mechanism to search for users that have a OnDemand password
- there should be a mechanism to remove a user's OnDemand password
- there should be a mechanism to indicate when a user account last logged in with Google SSO and with OnDemand password
fields.summary: Ability to allow/block use of local credentials for Google linked accounts

fields.description: As a security-minded customer, I would like to integrate my more sensitive, locally-hosted tools such as Crowd, with my less sensitive OnDemand collaboration tools (JIRA, GreenHopper, Confluence) so I don't have to worry as much about risking my IP/code.
fields.summary: Allow Atlassian OnDemand to integrate with locally-hosted Crowd

fields.description: As JIRA, Confluence and Crowd has implemented user renaming, it will be also very beneficial to have that implemented for OnDemand platform as well.
fields.summary: Implement user rename in OnDemand

fields.description:
When inviting a user, it would be useful to be able to set up specific items (starts with the defaults but can be customized for the user in the invite). 

i.e. The defaults are great for a starting point but it would be good to specify customization of them for a particular invite only.
fields.summary: Display application access config on invite user

fields.description: At present the login screens don't conform to the OnDemand (either JIRA or Confluence) theme, i.e. the colours and icons are all different. Could we please make it so that the theme matches?
fields.summary: Make the login screen use the OnDemand theme
Allow Cloud User Management to function as a User Server for BTF products

fields.description:
Please update this page accordingly: https://www.google.com/enterprise/marketplace/viewListing?productListingId=3421+6389312883797462351

If JIRA OnDemand only uses Google credentials to authenticate then you really need to update the permissions that you are asking when OnDemand is installed from the Google Marketplace. At the moment it is asking for *alot* more than just the login credentials and this can definitely spook people (witness my little group going from "get JIRA going today" to "woa... thats no good... lets just use a spreadsheet or something". It is also a good thing from a covering Atlassian's backside point of view: if you ask for permissions than you need and then (heaven forbid) get hacked you will do less damage to your customers than you might otherwise.
fields.summary: Update Google SSO requirements

fields.description:
See also https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/221902/does-the-contact-administrators-form-form-work-in-jira-ondemand.

I'm trying to add a contact-administrators option to an OnDemand instance, but setting this option to ON in System > General Configuration > Options doesn't seem to do anything. I guess I'm expecting the "to request an account..." message on the login screen to link to a contact-administrators form, as I do see on my download/installed instances, but that does not work for me in OnDemand.

There is documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Restricted+Functions+in+Atlassian+OnDemand that hints at this as unavailable, but it doesn't seem to address the "Contact Administrators" functionality directly.

The message that's displayed on the login screen for OnDemand, "To request an account, please contact your JIRA administrators", is not really valuable to a user who doesn't already know who those administrators are. And, the experience for an administrator trying to enable this is somewhat garden-path, in that everything on the System > General Configuration > Options would seem to imply that it should work as expected. If nothing else, it would be helpful to see that general configuration option removed or disabled.
fields.summary: Support for "Contact Administrators" Form

fields.description:
Administrators should be able to add and update the user profile information:
Personal:
-Full Name
-Email
-Phone
-IM
-Website
-About Me

Company:
-Position
-Department
-Location
fields.summary: Allow Administrators to update user profiles with additional information

fields.description:
In BTF versions of JIRA, the "remember me" checkbox is before the login button, which means keyboard access is easy (user, tab, pass, tab, space to fill checkbox, tab, enter).

In OD, the checkbox is after the login button, which means the flow sucks. See the [original issue|JRA-31202] raised by a customer in JRA. (Who I have added as the reporter of this one)

See both attachments.
fields.summary: Change the order of login and "leave me logged in" checkbox in tabbing

fields.description: Client requests ability to customise user management with colours/logo so it can match the JIRA and Confluence instances.
fields.summary: Customise User Management with Company Colours/Logo

fields.description:
If you're an external user it makes an unauthenticated request.  So if you've made the document public, it will show within JIRA Studio
but if you've just shared it with a JIRA Studio external user, we have no way to authenticate as that external user currently.  It would be a good improvement to add OAuth logins for external users.  I've been told this can then be turned into a plugin that all instances could use.
fields.summary: Use OAuth authentication for Google Doc authentication

fields.description:
*Currently*
The new GApps integration (Agni), is reducing the ability to control user permissions before new user logs in whereby the admin has to *wait* until the user logs in so the new user entry can be created in OD then the admin will add the required permissions.

*Before*
GApps was syncing  all the users into the instance by creating them, the admin will assign the required permissions before the new user logs in.

*Improvement*
Will be feasible having the users created before they log-in which can give the admin buffer of time assigning the required permissions without waiting to the new user until he/she logs in so the new user entry can be created.
fields.summary: Synchronise new Google Apps users automatically before login

fields.description:
The OnDemand UI is confusing during a failure login. Users are presented with an empty dashboard without much information on how to proceed. 

Also the Login link displayed on the 'empty dashboard' page does not work unless you clear the cookies.

This behavior is faced mainly by Google Apps users.
fields.summary: Confusing empty dashboard during login failure

fields.description:
At present the 'delete users' function in Atlassian OnDemand is far too prevalent and deactivating users in too challenging.

For example, in the user browser there are four buttons, one is delete and none are deactivate:

!delete_browser.png!

When looking at the user itself there are 5 options, one is delete and none are deactivate:

!delete_user.png!

Deleting users is very difficult, as they cannot be a reporter, assignee or have made any comments (in JIRA) whereas deactivating users is by far preferred. At the moment deactivating users is done by removing application access and removing them from all groups, which is not a very intuitive process.

I'd like for there to be an easier way to deactivate users.
fields.summary: Make it easier to deactivate users in Atlassian OnDemand and harder to delete them

fields.description:
Google recently released support for adding secondary domains to a Google Apps account. We should investigate what impact this will have on Google App integration in JIRA Studio.

* http://googleenterprise.blogspot.com/2010/06/introducing-multi-domain-support-in.html
* http://www.google.com/support/a/bin/answer.py?answer=182452
* http://code.google.com/googleapps/domain/gdata_provisioning_api_v2.0_developers_protocol.html#Managing_Multiple_Domain_Users
fields.summary: Support integration with multiple Google Apps domains

fields.description:
Using https://chartboost.atlassian.net/admin/users as our example. 

Pagination at the bottom of the screen shows *1  2 ... Next* 

Clicking 2 or Next will result in *Prev 1  2  3  .... Next*
Clicking 3 or Next will result in *Prev 1  2  3  4.... Next*
Clicking 4 or Next will result in *Prev 1  2  3  4  5.... Next*
And so on .... 

Going through the motions until hitting the last page will indicate the 120 users:

https://chartboost.atlassian.net/admin/apps?start-index=120 

However, I would need to follow the above steps again or each time unless I book mark the URL https://chartboost.atlassian.net/admin/apps?start-index=120  

It seems like we could streamline this a bit to get a better pulse when attempting to get a quick user count and/or entire view of the user base. 

More specifically:

#  Next Link appears to be redundant to pages 2, 3, 4 and 5. 
#  It would seem that Next should really be the Last page.
fields.summary: Pagination - Cannot Select Last Page

fields.description: JIRA's existing user management not only shows the users but also the groups that those users are in. Removing the display of groups makes it much more painful to keep track of which users are in which groups (both from a customer admin and a support perspective).
fields.summary: Provide option to display all groups memberships for each user on the Users list

fields.description: Customers are looking at adding Bitbucket integration but would like to have the same login for Bitbucket and Atlassian OnDemand or another way to SSO between both.
fields.summary: Add authentication integration for OnDemand and Bitbucket

fields.description: It would be good to be able to log out of one session, but still maintain all others (other browsers/locations) for one user.
fields.summary: Logging out of OnDemand invalidates all sessions for current user

fields.description:
*Current Behaviour:*
Select a single group and select 'Add'.  This allows you to add multiple 'users' to a single group

*Improved Behaviour:*
Within group menu a button for 'Bulk Group Management'.  This allows the selection of multiple groups.  Multiple users are then able to be added to these groups. A checkbox, for example. 

The usage would be for administrators of OnDemand instances who occasionally create users on bulk and then need to add them to multiple groups.

An additional use case is when a profile is being deactivated and need to be removed from all groups.
fields.summary: Bulk Add and Remove Users to and from Multiple Groups

fields.description:
When instance has been rebooted, there may be SocketTimedOut errors in the user management. Customers would appreciate an error that was more readable and understandable:

!Jira_instance_not_reachable_-_Atlassian_Support_System.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve SocketTImedOut Error in AOD User Management to be more human

fields.description:
Currently the synchronisation of the Gapps user accounts in the style:
'first' + 'last' name

An improvement would be to allowing the fields to be configurable:
i.e. 'last' + 'first' name 
or, pulling the Google+ display name as the user's Name in JIRA.
fields.summary: Google Apps fields sync to be customised

fields.description: Would like the ability to generate a list of all groups and the users who are members (of that group), or use a specific type of license (regular vs Service Desk customer). Ideally this would be in CSV or some form that could be imported into a spreadsheet so I could do various filters and pivots on it.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to export user/group data

fields.description:
There is a known limitation on the login permission in OnDemand, as documented in section "The permission for logging in" in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+application+permissions

bq. Even for users that only need to access Confluence, they still need the 'JIRA Users' global permission; otherwise, they cannot log in to Confluence.

When customer administrator wants to finely configure groups and permissions, they must give JIRA Users global permission to all OnDemand users, no matter whether they are granted access to JIRA or not.

The page to configure global permissions is https://instance-name.atlassian.net/secure/admin/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa

There are two ways to work around this, assuming the customer administrator wants to separate the permissions for JIRA users from Confluence users and has created 'jira-users' group and 'confluence-users' group, for example:
* Keep the 'users' group to track all OnDemand users.
** Use the default configuration for JIRA Users global permission, which is the 'users' group.
** The administrator will need to map JIRA's Project Role for Users to 'jira-users' group instead of 'users' group (https://instance-name.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjectRoles.jspa)
** The administrator will also need to edit the permission in all existing permission schemes (https://instance-name.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPermissionSchemes.jspa) that grant permission explicitly to the 'users' group and change those to the 'jira-users' group. Note that the default permission scheme only grants permissions to Project Roles instead of groups, which is the recommended way to configure permissions, so there is no need to change to reconfigure it if that has not been changed.
** Whenever a new user is created, the new user is automatically added to the 'users' group. The administrator will need to manually add the user to 'jira-users' and/or 'confluence-users' group.
** When deactivating a user, remove the user from 'users' group as well as from 'jira-users' and 'confluence-users' group.

* Remove the 'users' group entirely
** Grant the JIRA Users global permission to both 'jira-users' group and 'confluence-users' group (and 'fisheye-users' group etc if applicable) in https://instance-name.atlassian.net/secure/admin/GlobalPermissions!default.jspa. Delete the JIRA Users global permission granted to 'users' group.
** The administrator will need to map JIRA's Project Role for Users to 'jira-users' group instead of 'users' group (https://instance-name.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjectRoles.jspa)
** The administrator will also need to edit the permission in all existing permission schemes (https://instance-name.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPermissionSchemes.jspa) that grant permission explicitly to the 'users' group and change those to the 'jira-users' group. Note that the default permission scheme only grants permissions to Project Roles instead of groups, which is the recommended way to configure permissions, so there is no need to change to reconfigure it if that has not been changed.
** Whenever a new user is created, the new user is automatically added to both 'jira-users' group and 'confluence-users' group (and 'fisheye-users' group etc if applicable). The administrator will need to manually remove the user from 'jira-users' or 'confluence-users' group.
** When deactivating a user, remove the user from 'jira-users' and 'confluence-users' group.
fields.summary: As an OnDemand administrator, I would like to configure so that users with no JIRA license can log into OnDemand without being given the JIRA Users global permission

fields.description:
Currently if a Google Apps user does not return a first and a last name to us then we do not allow the user authentication to continue and the user gets an authentication error.

It may be possible to make is so that the First and Last names are not required and so this issue is here to track that that discussion.
fields.summary: Users cannot currently be created without a First and Last name.

fields.description: There are really at least 2 profiles running around, each with their own avatar, their own user display name, etc. There's the wiki profile and the Jira profile, both which have to be updated and edited separately. It would be nice to combine them
fields.summary: Combine Profiles

fields.description: The ability to clone a user with all it's groups  (at least) system permissions and application access could be very helpful for overall system administration.
fields.summary: Make possible to clone a user account.

fields.description:
Allow websudo (Secure Administrator) to be enabled in JIRA and Confluence instances in OnDemand.

In my experience with JIRA installed, websudo has proven useful as an indicator that I'm not just doing normal user operations, but have crossed the line into operations that have broader effect. E.g. editing workflows.

I was disappointed to discover that this nice, safety-net feature wasn't available in OnDemand instances. See support ticket JST-104514.
fields.summary: Allow websudo to be enabled in JIRA and Confluence OnDemand

fields.description:
In JIRA it was possible to view all the Project Roles a user belonged to. This was JIRA specific functionality which cannot be reached from the new Unified Admin.

As an admin this is useful for finding out all the project a user has access to.
fields.summary: Allow access to Project Role Viewer

fields.description:
Customers would appreciate if the central user management for Jira and Confluence should be featuring the following:

1. Filter in list view regarding to which applications a user is granted access, e.g Jira, Confluence or both.
2. In list view, it should be visible to which a user has access, e.g. Jira, Confluence or both.

This would especially help very much in circumstance where a lot of users must be managed and when access is granted according to volatile circumstances.
fields.summary: Improve JIRA and Confluence User Management

fields.description: Some customers have given feedback about wanting to see more users on one page view. This will allow those with a larger user base that want a larger list displayed to set it up themselves.
fields.summary: Provide a configurable 'number of X per page' setting on the Users/Groups pages

fields.description:
We just got back the "Last Login" information about users as part of AOD-7019. The main reason we need the Last Login information is that we want to be able to know which user(s) are no longer using JIRA or Confluence, so we can free up licences.

The problem we have now is that it is not possible to have the list of the users ordered by their last login, which would help sorting out the ones that we want to revoke licences.

Being able to sort by clicking on the columns would help a lot to accomplish this task.
fields.summary: Ability to sort on all columns in User Management screen

fields.description: Per the issue summary, will be more feasible to notify the admin of the instance once the license hit the limit count.
fields.summary: As an admin, I'd like to get notified when the instance hit the license limit count

fields.description: Could additional identity providers get added to provide SSO capability to OnDemand besides Google Apps.
fields.summary: Single Sign-On support for JIRA OnDemand besides Google Apps

fields.description:
If you are using GApps integration you have to respect a certain form for the username, otherwise it is not possible to map them and the user will be created.
But administrators would like to map the users manually after the integration
fields.summary: Allow manual user mapping after GApps integration

fields.description:
Provide ways to do large sets of user data manipulation.
Such as... 
* adding all users in a group to another group
* adding everyone into a group
* bulk removal of users from a group (or multiple groups)
* bulk add users to a group
fields.summary: Provide more advanced, bulk group/user management

fields.description: If an instance has Google Apps sync disabled and they wish to add a new user, this is a manual process. Those users may like to work around this issue by using the API/RPC to create a new Google User and force sync when needed, which isn't presently possible.
fields.summary: Add ability to add Google Apps users via API/RPC

fields.description:
I know that the trend among web sites has been to create a logout screen that does not include a login box, but this is terrible usability.

When I log out, there is at least a 50% probability that I will want to log back in without closing my browser or going elsewhere.  In my case, the only reason I'm logging back in is because I've been logged out by some update to the system.  Half the time I end up logging in, realizing that I've forgotten to check the checkbox to remain logged in, and then I log out so that I can check the checkbox.

PLEASE put a login box on the logout screen.
fields.summary: add login box to logout screen
Update Google Apps Integration to use new API

fields.description: I would like to use my business Active Directory identity to authenticate to my Atlassian OnDemand environment. I could indirectly do this via the Atlassian OnDemand Google Apps SSO support. This would be an expensive route since my company does not currently use or plan to use Google Apps. Offering an on-premise or hosted CROWD to Atlassian OnDemand CROWD connection would be a better solution. A logical alternative might be a CROWD Directory Sync plugin to Atlassian OnDemand (similar in concept to the Google Apps Directory Sync - GADS)built by Atlassian or a 3rd party using the new/beta plugin framework. Unfortunately, I see no evidence of an existing, planned or requested plugin. This improvement suggestion is similar to AOD-3397
fields.summary: Allow On-premise or hosted CROWD to Atlassian OnDemand CROWD connection

fields.description:
From support ticket:
bq. This is a security heads-up prompted by a discussion on a mailing list. The logout from Atlassian OnDemand is "local", i.e. the user is not logged out of Google on selecting the logout from the JIRA interface. That means google (gmail, calendar and, erm, JIRA) can still be accessed unchallenged after successfully logging out from Atlassian (assuming the same browser session). In this case I believe that the onus is on the service (JIRA) to inform the end user of the situation, and provide appropriate links to logout of the identity provider (Google). It would be trivial; a simple link to https://accounts.google.com/Logout. This is especially important for users on shared computers.
fields.summary: Warning for Google users about separate logouts are needed between JIRA and Google apps

fields.description:
Users that don't have the {{active}} column set to {{F}} in Crowd's database will still show in Confluence's people directory and at-mentions even if they're not members of any groups.

User Management should set the {{active}} flag to false when a user is no longer a member of any groups (and conversely, should set it to {{true}} once they're re-added to groups).
fields.summary: "active" flag in Crowd should be set to false once a user is no longer a member of any groups

fields.description:
JIRA OnDemand with Google Apps enabled - /secure/admin/user/ViewUser.jspa?name=<username>

There's a link that reads 'Set Password' that is causing some confusion for administrators.  When <username> is a Google User, the link text should instead say something like 'Set SVN/RSS Password'.
fields.summary: Modify 'Set Password' link text if user is a Google User

fields.description: It would be good if you can enter all products with a single account, and configure 2 or more email adresses on it.
fields.summary: Have one Account for all atlassian products and can configure 2 emailadresses

fields.description:
There is a clearly defined (and open) standard for supporting MFA in the TOTP standard.  

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time-based_One-time_Password_Algorithm
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6238

The number of external integrations is limited to Google, and while it would be good to also integrate into Amazon, etc, for smallish (and for users NOT in a Google Apps domain, external contractors as the documentation even suggests, stronger authentication should be supported.  
Having integrated the standard already, I know how trivial it is, so if we could get this done, it would REALLY allow organizations who need stronger authentication look at the product.
fields.summary: Support TOTP for authentications

fields.description:
Would assist in user auditing and usage reports.

Examples:
* access to attachments
* review API calls/frequency
* usage statistics
fields.summary: Provide read access to Apache access logs

fields.description:
If an admin adds (for example) 'JIRA-users' to Confluence Global permissions as a 'can use' permission; revoking Confluence Access removes the user from JIRA-users as well, effectively removing their JIRA access.

While this is logical, Admins should be warned of this behaviour if they have groups with access to both products. As this looks like a bug (unchecking one box suddenly unchecks both boxes).
fields.summary: Administrators should be warned if there are overlapping groups with access

fields.description:
Currently, all JIRA OnDemand instances created before May 24th 2014 have an auto-invite feature send out to those in the 'Developers' group. This would essentially give people access that shouldn't have access to code on Bitbucket. While this is turned off with instances created after the above date, we have no way of warning older customers that they should configure their instance:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Configure+Automatic+Team+Invites

A small improvement would be something such as a banner/link to this setting, warning anyone who has this feature enabled to configure their automatic invites. This feature is currently costing a lot of Bitbucket support time in log searching for administrators who are not aware that people are getting automatically invited.
fields.summary: Create a banner to warn users about the DVCS auto-inviting function when integrated with Bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible for an administrator to make changes to another users profile information (such as Company Information) in Confluence. (see details of profile information that is not editable in new user management system.

This information can only be updated by the user themselves (example [^Screen_Shot_2014-07-15_at_2_14_45_pm.jpg]).
fields.summary: Allow Confluence Administrators to edit another Confluence Users profile information such as company information

fields.description:
Provide the ability to specify default groups for all types of users.

In the previous user Management panel, this existed only for Google Apps users. The feature should be available and be configurable for all users.
fields.summary: Default groups should be configurable in Unified Admin

fields.description: The Log In screen displays *Use your Atlassian OnDemand account*, and users can get confused by this, while trying to enter their my.atlassian.com account credentials. It would be good to have the message display *Use your <account>.atlassian.net account* instead.
fields.summary: Modify message on Log In page

fields.description:
h3.Problem statement

The latest new user email read as follows:

{quote}Subject: [Atlassian] USERNAME, welcome to Atlassian OnDemand
Sent by: jira@example.atlassian.net

Message: Your OnDemand account has been created! Atlassian OnDemand is the à la carte hosted development and collaboration solution for teams building great software. Log in now to track your issues and tasks, collaborate with your team, and stay on top of project activity.{quote}

- Receiving emails from _*jira*@example.atlassian.net_ can be confusing when invited users will only use Confluence.
- This causes support issues as the new user email is getting ignored or deleted by users.

h3.Suggested solution
1. Can the invitation be sent from _*cloud*@example.atlassian.net_?
2. Can the message be more generic - not every Cloud customer is using it for "building great software". I've attached the old Confluence OnDemand invitation for reference: [^confluenceinvitemessage.png].

Ideally, the Cloud site administrators should have the ability to create a custom message template. 
We actually send out a 2nd follow up message to this invitation that also cover tips such as reminders to set their time zone, setting a default landing page, notifications and where to get more help.
fields.summary: Allow for custom emails being sent to welcome new users

fields.description:
We currently link access to Jira and Confluence via Onelogin using form scripts. within Onelogin we have to manually input everyone password and then enter it into Atlassian. 

The issue is if a user changes their password using your forget password link then it doesn't match the password on onelogin anymore and the are then unable to login. I then have to reset the password in onelogin and in Atlassian.

by removing the link at the Atlassian login or at least putting a message linking them to onelogin will save me time and the use from headaches.

Thank you,

Brian
fields.summary: Removing "forget password" Link for Jira and Confluence

fields.description:
I originally submitted this item to Support.
Reference: https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/jst/problem-report-96177

The resolution to my support ticket was to log a feature request for review by the engineering team. Please review the support items for all details but this is the summary, as reported by one of our user. 

1. Basically cookies can have a set life to live (remember me) before you need to renew them (even their webpage says - that it’s set to 30 days). (...) Even though I have the cookie in my cookie list their web site ignores it when I browse with access to cookies turned off. I use this method with other sites, and they work, they just need renewing once in a while which I don’t mind doing. (...) They must be trying to set the cookie or can’t identify the fact that it exists.

To recap:
1). The cookie file exists:
2). I prefer to browse with nobody adding or updating current cookies - which works fine with other sites:
3) Maybe it's related to them setting a google cookie as well (I always delete google cookies). 

Note: In this particular case, we were asked by your support department  to confirm if keeping the Google cookies made a difference - It did not. 

The support reply read:Thanks for confirming!  The behavior is different because we are a different website. Our security model requires cookies for verification.

My response was: Thanks for the reply. However, this is a serious concern for us - especially for some of your consultants that are mindful of data access and tracking. I can see that if the users want to make some big changes to the account, then you'll need to update the cookie. Cookies are definitely good for security, but why do you require to have them turned on all the time to just read a page? Is it not possible to keeping settings in a database on your end? Or are you putting all the info into cookies and so that you need constant access to them on the user computer?

Your comments would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: Reading OnDemand pages without cookies always turned on

fields.description:
My question, is there a way to create a role in Confluence which will give people permission to do just "User management" ?

At this time there is not away but I would like to have the ability to have a roll for this so I can assign a user admin rights to add just users.
fields.summary: Create a new role which will give access to usermanagement only

fields.description: When bulk editing group memberships (currently it is only possible to do one user to many groups or one group to many users), I would like to be able to select users or groups from a list instead of only having the option to type their names.
fields.summary: Select users by clicking instead of by typing their names
Synchronise changes to usernames between Google Apps and OnDemand users

fields.description:
I'm fully aware of this ticket: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1822 

Given the clear user and administrator desire for this feature and the fact that the vast majority of companies DON'T use Google Apps and DO use Active Directory in some fashion even if it is in the cloud, it seems imperative that Atlassian re-evaluate its insistence that it won't support SAML natively outside of Google Apps. 

Is there a rationale why you're doing this? Because I'm now tasked with finding a solution that cuts Atlassian out completely given your intransigence.
fields.summary: Allow SSO from SAML 2.0 Compliant Software Such As ADFS

fields.description: By default "Remember my login on this computer" cookies expire in two weeks. Customer should have the hability to overwrite this time to never.
fields.summary: Ability to choose the default expiration time for cookies in OnDemand

fields.description:
On the sign-on page of an OnDemand instance, if a user who does not have application access signs on, they are taken to a empty page where they cannot logout/login. The login button at the top, when pressed just reloads the page and doesn't take them to the sign-on page.

A log out button that logs the user out would be beneficial.
fields.summary: Logout Button For Users Without Application Access

fields.description:
I want to fully create and set-up a user before inviting the user. I want to specify that user's groups, provide them access to certain projects and Confluence pages, etc., before sending out their invitation to join my OnDemand JIRA instance.

Unfortunately there seems to be no way to manually send an invitation after I manually set up a user! Instead, there are obtuse, unnecessary workarounds. See e.g.:

* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/87842/is-there-a-way-to-resend-sign-up-invitation-email-to-the-users
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/29226/how-can-i-resend-a-new-user-an-email-with-login-information
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/23239/re-send-notification-emails-to-existing-users

None of these questions have a satisfactory answer, and the workarounds provided are time-consuming and not user-friendly for users for which JIRA is new to begin with.

If the system has the capability to send a signup invitation to a user, it should have the ability to _resend_ that same invitation to the same user. In fact in this case, the invitation has never been sent, as I set up the user manually.

JIRA shouldn't place me in the position of secure key management and distribution. I shouldn't have to assign a password and then try to transport it securely to the user. The system has capability to send an invitation link. It should allow me to manually send that invitation link whenever I choose, as many times as I like.
fields.summary: Way to send/resend invitations to new OnDemand JIRA users.

fields.description:
Our client has staff members that need to be able to create new users, but the only way to currently do this is to make them an admin for the whole site. 

We are looking for the option to create a distinction between a primary admin (for the whole site) and an admin (who can create users, but not necessarily have access to the whole site). 

Our Suggestion - Create a global permission that allows people to manage users, but not administer other aspects of Confluence/OnDemand.
Is this possible?

We also understand that there is a way to send an invite code to new users (self-sign up), but we also need to add new users to specific groups so this option wouldn't work.
fields.summary: Enhanced Global Permissions - Manage Users, but not Administer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Clients are not able to update their email addresses for their Atlassian ID. 
There should be a way to be able to update this information in case someone leaves the company or rolls change. This will also eliminate the headache of having to create a new email address, then link the accounts or having to create a support ticket.

h3. Suggested Solution
The ability to update the email address will allow the clients an easier way to manage all the accounts if someone has to leave, change roll, and other reasons. 

h3. Workaround 
Create a new Atlassian ID and migrate your license to it by following the procedures outlined in our [FAQ|https://www.atlassian.com/licensing/purchase-licensing#managingmyaccount-1].
fields.summary: Updating My Atlassian ID email address
Support SAML integration with Cloud apps

fields.description:
{panel:title=Resolution Status|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#4c9aff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

We have shipped an [integration with OKTA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/create-an-okta-account-for-your-organization-978195327.html] to enable Atlassian Access customers to connect to LDAP servers at no additional cost.

Regards,
 The Atlassian Access team
{panel}
----
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of 13 March 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#4c9aff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

As Dave mentioned in the last update, we’ve implemented [User provisioning with SCIM |https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html]and you can use this mechanism to automate user and group provisioning.
 As a quick summary:
 * We currently support [Okta|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/configure-user-provisioning-with-okta-957492956.html], [OneLogin,|https://onelogin.service-now.com/support?id=kb_article&sys_id=e376f0d5db9bd0943de43e043996197f&kb_category=871969b0db185340d5505eea4b9619f9] and [Azure AD|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/saas-apps/atlassian-cloud-provisioning-tutorial].
 * For other identity providers, you can use the [User provisioning (SCIM) API (documentation at developer.atlassian.com)|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/intro/] to sync users and groups over to Atlassian products.
 With regards to single sign-on, we support [SAML SSO|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html] and you can find the instructions to the supported Identity Providers on the linked documentation page.

Regards,  
 The Atlassian Access team
{panel}
----
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of 31 Jan 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#4c9aff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

We're pleased to announce that documentation for the [User provisioning (SCIM) API is now available on developer.atlassian.com|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/admin/user-provisioning/rest/]. The API is an implementation of the [SCIM specification|http://www.simplecloud.info/] and is intended to be used to sync users and groups from an identity provider to an [Atlassian organization|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/set-up-an-atlassian-organization-938859734.html]. Once you have linked an Atlassian Cloud site (like example.atlassian.net) to your organization, users and groups will be synced to your site and you can use them to control access to Jira and Confluence Cloud as well as permissions within those products. [Learn more about how automatic user provisioning works with Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/user-provisioning-959305316.html].

There are several key benefits to automating user provisioning for Atlassian Cloud:
 * It saves you time as an administrator by automating the process of creating and removing Atlassian accounts for your users
 * It improves security by reducing errors in the provisioning/deprovisioning process
 * It can help reduce costs by ensuring you are not billed for users who are no longer active

The SCIM API is intended for customers who are not already using one of our supported identity providers. [We currently support *Okta*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/configure-user-provisioning-with-okta-957492956.html] and are actively working on support for *Azure Active Directory* and *Onelogin*. If you are using one of these identity providers, we recommend using the supported Atlassian app for these identity providers as this will simplify the configuration process.

We're actively working in this area and will share another update when support for additional identity providers is available.

Regards,
 Dave Meyer
 Atlassian Access Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Support LDAP integration with Cloud

fields.description:
Currently for Google App integration with OnDemand instance, they are required to provide access to the Google Drive. And this is due to some feature no longer in active state. 

It is expected to be able to restrict the access and able to configure the GApp integration.
fields.summary: To be Able to Perform the GApp Integration without Allowing Access to Google Drive

fields.description:
Introduce user level properties within the new User Management menu.

The availability of user properties could be useful for applying issue-level security if the option to select 'user properties' was developed within JIRA and Issue-level security.
fields.summary: User Level properties

fields.description:
Do deactivated users (removed from all groups) count towards my user count? It seems they do. This will become a problem for me this year.

It's annoying that deactivated users (removed from all groups) still show up in drop downs. This leads to them being mistakenly assigned to issues.

It really is time this "hack" was addressed for OnDemand customers. What's the ETA on a true deactivation function?
fields.summary: Ability to deactivate/activate users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 19 Nov 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for providing your feedback here. It's obvious that our recent changes to simplify the experience for user creation has created problems for some of you.

We have been reviewing all the feedback that's come through. The primary issues so far are:
 # Admins are unable to explicitly set a username during new user account creation
 # Admins are unable to control if emails are sent to new users about their account

We are looking to address this feedback by essentially bringing back a version of the old create user screen that would allow admins to explicitly create a user, specify username at the same time and have the option to control email send.

While we are working on this, we wanted to draw your attention to a new feature that we've just released that should help in the interim and has also been an existing feature request. *You are now able to change usernames for users.* This is available right now for all instances (excluding currently those that are integrated with Google Apps). You can do this on a per user basis via the ‘edit’ button on a user’s page. You may need to refresh your page if you don't see that you can do it immediately. This can be used as a temporary measure to change the usernames for newly created users until we have the create user experience fixed.

Unfortunately, there is no straightforward workaround to stop the sending of an email to new users in the interim. 
A way to get around this: use an email address that you have access to (it cannot be currently used in your OnDemand site), in order to intercept the email sent. When you receive the email, click on the link to set the password to complete the account setup and then change the email address to the correct one.

Some of you mentioned that there was a lack of communication about this change. We followed our standard pre-release communication process here and mentioned this before the release came about. We publish pre-release upgrade notes every week before a release is planned to go out - [this was last week’s|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/2014/11/13/Upcoming+Atlassian+OnDemand+upgrade+for+week+starting+on+16+November+2014]. If you’re not doing so already, I recommend that you ‘watch’ [all blog posts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewrecentblogposts.action?key=AOD] in the AOD space to receive these updates in your inbox.

Thanks again for your feedback,
Helen Hung
Product Manager
{panel}
A new update for user management in Atlassian OnDemand has been released and customers are unable to customise the username for new users.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/16+November+2014+to+21+November+2014]
{quote}In addition to this change, we've also combined the "Create user" and "Invite user" functionality. To add a new user, click the Create users button and enter the email addresses of the users for which you'd like to create an account. Usernames will automatically be generated based on users' email addresses. New users will be sent an email to set their password.

Note: The license count is updated when you create the user (not when the user logs in), so creating users takes a license for each application you give them access to.
 A new update for user management in Atlassian OnDemand has been released and it removed the option to create users manually.
{quote}
fields.summary: Request for the previous method of creating new users

fields.description: we would like the users to directly access the service portal and submit their requests without any sign ups. ie. using their corporate login or Active directory they should be allowed to access the portal and if the user is not on service desk system already, service desk should automatically create a profile for them. could you please submit a feature request and provide us an estimation.No of users are roughly 800.
fields.summary: Setting up JIRA users

fields.description:
I work with a large number of OnDemand instances, and it can be difficult to keep track of which ones I have accounts on, and what the status of my access is.

It would be very useful to have a listing of all sites I have an account on, available for me to access.

This listing could be provided on my Atlassian ID page.
fields.summary: Create a listing of all OnDemand instances I have access to

fields.description: Provide the ability for admins to select what type of data to be displayed on the main list of users: all group memberships, last login, app access etc.
fields.summary: Ability to configure the columns of data displayed on main users list

fields.description:
It would be great if there was a way to have the deactivated users hidden,
or at the very least, marked where they can be easily distinguishable from
the active users in the User Management configuration page.
fields.summary: Ability to hide users on User Management Configuration page after deactivation

fields.description:
h2. Basic Idea

It would be fantastic if, should a user not exist in the system, I could just invite them from wherever I happened to be in such a way that they would have permission to access whatever resource that I invited them to see.

Hopefully I would see something like this:

!Screen Shot 2014-09-10 at 1.44.54 pm.png!

h2. Requirements

* Every product in the Atlassian suite would work this way with harmonious UI.
* Non-admins would be able to use this feature too (with an approval flow).
* Works with all places in which I see a list of users. Mentions, JIRA Fields etc.

h3. Optional Extras

* Users are granted access to see whatever they are mentioned on when invited. (Or, I will be told that the invited user will not be able to see the system when invited)
fields.summary: Inline Invite User
